Name: Mummy of a falcon
Description: This object is presented as a packet of oval form, wrapped in bitumized linen. The inventory book identifies it as the mummy of an ibis, but X-ray study has revealed the skeleton of a young bird. What is more, the form of the beak demonstrates that it is the mummy of a falcon. It is uncertain whether the piece comes from the necropolis of Tell Heou, as the inventory mentions.
